issue.title: Normative encouragement in allocator requirements unclear

discussion.p: In 20.1.5, paragraph 5, the standard says that "Implementors are encouraged to supply libraries that can accept allocators that encapsulate more general memory models and that support non-equal instances." This is intended as normative encouragement to standard library implementors. However, it is possible to interpret this sentence as applying to nonstandard third-party libraries.

resolution.p: In 20.1.5, paragraph 5, change "Implementors" to "Implementors of the library described in this International Standard".

rationale.p: The LWG believes the normative encouragement is already sufficiently clear, and that there are no important consequences even if it is misunderstood.
